title: Mark Mobius Says Weaker Rupee To Help Export-Oriented Companies, Trump 2.0 To Benefit India - News18
PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates - News18
summary:
PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

State-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) has revised its fixed deposit (FD) interest rates, introducing new tenures effective January 1, 2025. The new 303-day FD offers 7% interest, while the 506-day FD offers 6.7% for general citizens.

  • PNB's FD interest rates range from 3.5% to 7.25% for tenures of 7 days to 10 years.
  • The highest rate of 7.25% is applicable for a 400-day tenure.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urges banks to improve deposit mobilization for sustainable credit growth.
“While credit growth has picked up, mobilisation of deposits could further be improved to fund the credit growth sustainably.” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This revision aims to attract more deposits, reflecting efforts to enhance customer relationships and ensure efficient service delivery.
newTitle: PNB Adjusts FD Rates with New Tenures Effective January 2025

Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Finalised: How to Check Status Online

Last Updated: January 03, 2025, 22:50 IST

The allotment of the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is set to be finalised today, with a strong demand indicated by a 227.67 times subscription rate.

  • Indo Farm Equipment shares are trading at Rs 311 per share in the grey market, a 44.65% increase over the IPO price of Rs 215.
  • The IPO was open from December 31 to January 2 and received substantial interest across all investor categories.
  • The shares will be listed on both BSE and NSE on January 7, with investors receiving bank debit messages if allotted.
  • Investors can check the status of their allotment online via the official BSE website or Mas Services Limited’s portal.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

This IPO reflects significant investor interest and signals potential strong market performance upon listing.

title: Google Pixel finds traction in India’s premium smartphone market as OnePlus plummets - 9to5Google
summary:
Google Pixel Finds Traction in India’s Premium Smartphone Market as OnePlus Plummets

Publication Date: November 2024, Source: 9to5Google

Google Pixel is finally gaining traction in India’s premium smartphone market, as the brand managed to grow while OnePlus took a nosedive.

  • India saw 6.5 million premium smartphone shipments from Q1 2024 to Q3 2024, up from 4.2 million the previous year.
  • OnePlus's market share fell from 21% to just 6% in a year, while Samsung maintained a 30% share.
  • Google Pixel's growth jumped from 1% in 2023 to 5% in 2024, significantly due to the Pixel 8 being manufactured in India.
  • Apple holds a dominant position with roughly 56% market share in the premium segment.
“All the while, Apple continues to take up the bulk of the premium smartphone segment in India.”

This shift in market dynamics indicates a growing acceptance of Google Pixel among Indian consumers and highlights the declining popularity of OnePlus in the premium segment.
newTitle: Google Pixel Gains Ground in India’s Premium Smartphone Market as OnePlus Declines

title: Wockhardt’s 2 New Antibiotics In Global Spotlight: Chairman Khorakiwala Narrates Journey | Exclusive - News18
summary:
Wockhardt’s 2 New Antibiotics In Global Spotlight: Chairman Khorakiwala Narrates Journey | Exclusive

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: News18

Mumbai-based drugmaker Wockhardt has received final approval from India's drug regulatory authority to market its new antibiotic, Nafithromycin, effective against community-acquired bacterial pneumonia. Alongside, Zaynich has shown promise against major drug-resistant superbugs.

  • Nafithromycin branded as Miqnaf is claimed to be “10 times” more effective than current treatments.
  • The drug's launch in India is scheduled within the next few months.
  • Wockhardt has invested approximately $500 million in antibiotic research over the past two decades.
  • The development focuses on addressing rising antimicrobial resistance, with major implications for public health.
  • Zaynich is undergoing phase-III trials globally, expected to enter the Indian market by mid-2025.
“More than 50 lakh people die every year due to the resistance.” - Dr Habil Khorakiwala

The development of these antibiotics marks a significant achievement in combating drug-resistant infections, showcasing India's capability in pharmaceutical innovation.
newTitle: Wockhardt Unveils New Antibiotics Targeting Superbugs

title: How Ketan Parekh’s wife's phone helped SEBI uncover his Rs 65 crore front-running scam - The Economic Times
EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed - News18
summary:
EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Union Labour and Employment Minister, Mansukh Mandaviya, has announced that a new Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) mobile application and debit card facility will be available to subscribers by May-June. This will streamline the withdrawal process significantly.

  • The EPFO ATM card will not allow full contribution withdrawal but simplifies access to funds.
  • Work on EPFO 2.0 (IT system upgrade) is nearly complete and will precede the launch of EPFO 3.0.
  • The new system aims to centralise claim settlements.
  • Ongoing discussions between the RBI and Finance Ministry to facilitate banking services for EPFO subscribers.
  • Withdrawals will be subject to a limit and do not require prior approval from the EPFO.
“During the Modi government’s tenure from 2014 to 2024, 17.19 crore individuals secured employment.”

This initiative by the government aims to ease the withdrawal process for EPFO subscribers and improve employment opportunities.
newTitle: EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed

Why Analysts Are Divided on Tesla Stock After Lackluster Q4 Deliveries Data - Investopedia
summary:
Why Analysts Are Divided on Tesla Stock After Lackluster Q4 Deliveries Data

Date: October 2023 | Source: Investopedia

Tesla shares have fallen significantly following the news of disappointing fourth-quarter production and delivery numbers, leading to varied reactions from analysts regarding the company's future prospects.

  • Tesla shares dropped 18% over five sessions, culminating in a 6% decline to $379.28.
  • Wedbush remains optimistic, maintaining an 'outperform' rating with a price target of $515.
  • JPMorgan is bearish, suggesting a potential sales decline if EV tax credits are eliminated.
  • Ten of 19 analysts tracked rate Tesla stock as a 'buy', with an average price target of $319.72.
“They believe shares will rise this year as a second Trump term benefits Tesla by accelerating the regulatory path to the company's autonomous taxis hitting the road.” - Wedbush Analysts

Overall, the analysts exhibit contrasting views on Tesla's future, reflecting uncertainty in the market following the recent delivery data.
newTitle: Why Analysts Are Divided on Tesla Stock After Lackluster Q4 Deliveries Data

title: RBI approves amalgamation of these two banks - Have account in them? Check latest update - ET Now
summary:
RBI Approves Amalgamation of National Co-operative Bank and Cosmos Cooperative Bank

Updated: January 3, 2025 | Source: ET Now News

The Reserve Bank of India has sanctioned the amalgamation scheme of the National Co-operative Bank Ltd., Bangalore with Cosmos Cooperative Bank Limited, Maharashtra, which will take effect on January 6, 2025.

  • The amalgamation will integrate the branches of both banks into one operational entity.
  • A monetary penalty of ₹8.30 lakh has been imposed on Cosmos Cooperative Bank for regulatory non-compliance.
  • The scheme is authorized under the Banking Regulation Act of 1949.
“The Scheme has been sanctioned in exercise of the powers conferred under Sub-Section (4) of Section 44A read with Section 56 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949,” RBI stated.

This move is significant for the banking landscape in India as it highlights regulatory oversight and compliance in the sector.
newTitle: RBI Approves Amalgamation of National Co-operative Bank and Cosmos Cooperative Bank

title: Dollar stays near two-year high, stocks struggle - Reuters
summary:
Dollar Stays Near Two-Year High as Stocks Struggle

Date: January 3, 2024

Source: Reuters

The dollar remains close to a two-year high as investors anticipate a widening growth gap between the U.S. and other economies, despite recent fluctuations in currency values and European gas price concerns.

  • European gas prices worry investors, impacting the euro and pound.
  • China's yuan and stocks are under significant pressure.
  • Trump's policies are influencing market sentiment.
  • U.S. share futures rose following a decline in Tesla stocks.
Ken Broux states, "If a currency’s valuation is an expression of the degree of confidence in the growth outlook relative to other economies, it is a damning assessment of how the market reads the euro zone outlook versus that of the U.S. in 2025."

The strength of the dollar reflects deep concerns over alternative economies, particularly in Europe and China, suggesting that the market anticipates significant shifts in growth dynamics.
newTitle: Dollar Stays Near Two-Year High as Stocks Struggle

title: Premium devices demand to push India smartphone mkt to over $50 bn in 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Demand for Premium Smartphones to Drive India's Market Beyond $50 Billion by 2025

Date: January 3, 2023 Source: PTI

India's smartphone market is set to explode, reaching over USD 50 billion by 2025, driven by the rising demand for premium devices, particularly from brands like Apple and Samsung.

  • The market size was approximately USD 37.9 billion in 2021.
  • Apple India reported a total income of ₹67,121.6 crore for the financial year 2024.
  • Samsung's mobile revenue stood at ₹71,157.6 crore.
  • The retail average selling price is anticipated to surpass USD 300 for the first time in 2025.
  • Chinese brands like Vivo, Oppo, and OnePlus are also making strides in the affordable premium segment.
  • OnePlus plans a ₹6,000 crore investment to support local market expansion.
  • The premium segment is expected to exceed 20% market share by 2025.
  • The trend towards premium smartphones is being fueled by consumers' interest in offline stores and AI-powered features.
“The shift towards premiumisation is also being driven by consumers increasingly opting for offline stores, where they can experience premium smartphones first-hand.”

This surge in demand reflects a broader trend in consumer preferences, indicating a shift towards higher-quality devices and increased competition among smartphone manufacturers.
newTitle: Demand for Premium Smartphones to Drive India's Market Beyond $50 Billion by 2025

title: NPS: This pension fund manager gave the highest return of 26% in past one year. Check top performers here | Mint - Mint
summary:
NPS: This pension fund manager gave the highest return of 26% in past one year. Check top performers here

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Livemint

The National Pension System (NPS) has reported significant returns from various pension fund managers over the past year, with DSP Pension Fund Managers leading the way with a 26.51% return.

Key Points:

  • The NPS is mandatory for government employees and optional for the private sector, offering tax benefits.
  • Two types of NPS accounts exist: Tier-I (mandatory for new subscribers) and Tier-II (optional add-on).
  • Top performers include DSP Pension Fund Managers with a return of 26.51%, while LIC Pension Fund had the lowest at 14.94%.
  • Returns range significantly among various fund managers.
The highest one-year-return of 26.51% was posted by DSP Pension Fund Managers.

The NPS continues to be a viable investment option for retirement planning, demonstrating the potential for robust returns depending on the chosen fund manager.
newTitle: Top Pension Fund Managers in India Report High Returns for 2025

title: Hindustan Unilever in talks to acquire Peak XV-backed Minimalist for up to $350M - TechCrunch
summary:
Hindustan Unilever in Talks to Acquire Minimalist for $350 Million

Date: Not provided Source: TechCrunch

Consumer goods giant Hindustan Unilever is negotiating to acquire the direct-to-consumer startup Minimalist for up to $350 million, aiming to enhance its skincare portfolio and expand its footprint in the health and wellbeing space.

  • Hindustan Unilever is in advanced talks to acquire Minimalist, a four-year-old startup.
  • The deal could be valued at up to $350 million.
  • Unilever's acquisition spree includes past investments in Oziva and Wellbeing Nutrition.
  • Minimalist reported a revenue increase of 89%, reaching $40.8 million in the past fiscal year.
  • This acquisition would expand Unilever's skincare offerings in India.
“In line with our business strategy, on an ongoing basis, we evaluate various strategic opportunities for the growth and expansion of our business.” - Hindustan Unilever Spokesperson

This acquisition aligns with Hindustan Unilever's strategy to grow its portfolio in a rapidly evolving market focused on health and wellness.
newTitle: Hindustan Unilever in Talks to Acquire Minimalist for $350 Million

Tiger Global—The Big Client Behind Ketan Parekhs Front-Running Scandal - NDTV Profit
summary:
Tiger Global—The 'Big Client' Behind Ketan Parekh's Front-Running Scandal

Date & Source: 03 Jan 2025, NDTV Profit

The US-based "big client" through which Ketan Parekh was allegedly front-running trades was Tiger Global Management, according to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). The regulator imposed a liability of ₹65.7 crore on Parekh and others involved in the case.

  • On November 11, 2022, two funds sold 52.5 lakh shares of PB Fintech Ltd.
  • Salgaokar was found to have connections with a US-based fund house regarding these trades.
  • Parekh executed trades systematically based on insider information, leading to illegal gains.
SEBI stated, "Parekh and Salgaocar devised the scheme," indicating the violation of security law provisions.

Overall, this case highlights significant concerns regarding market integrity and adherence to trading regulations.
newTitle: Tiger Global—The 'Big Client' Behind Ketan Parekh's Front-Running Scandal

title: Mahindra's SUV Sales Grow By 18% In Dec'24, Selling 41,424 Units - NDTV
summary:
Mahindra's SUV Sales Surge by 18% in December 2024, Reaching 41,424 Units

Date: January 25, 2025   Source: NDTV

Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. reported a significant growth in its auto sales for December 2024, particularly in the SUV segment.

  • Total auto sales for December 2024 reached 69,768 vehicles, a 16% increase.
  • SUV sales in the domestic market totaled 41,424 units, growing 18%.
  • The company's commercial vehicle sales reached 19,502 units.
  • Mahindra became the only Indian auto company on the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) world leader status within the Auto Sector.
  • The new electric SUVs, BE 6 and XEV 9E, will soon start accepting orders.
“We sold 41,424 SUVs, a growth of 18% and 69,768 total vehicles, a growth of 16% in December.” - Veejay Nakra, President, Automotive Division, M&M Ltd.

The impressive sales growth and recognition in sustainability highlight Mahindra's commitment to innovation and market leadership in the automotive sector.
newTitle: Mahindra's SUV Sales Surge by 18% in December 2024, Reaching 41,424 Units

title: Gold price clings to gains ahead of US ISM Manufacturing PMI - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Clings to Gains Ahead of US ISM Manufacturing PMI

Publication Date: December 01, 2024 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are showing a steady increase ahead of the US ISM Manufacturing PMI data for December, supported by safe-haven flows due to geopolitical tensions.

  • Gold prices are influenced by Joe Biden's discussions regarding Iran’s nuclear facilities.
  • The US Dollar Index is trading near a multi-year high, which may limit gold's price increases.
  • Gold's appeal is aided by subdued US Treasury bond yields.
  • In 2024, gold has seen over 27% gains, marking its best annual return since 2010 due to ongoing geopolitical conflicts.
"The Manufacturing PMI is seen steady at 48.4, suggesting that activities contracted at a steady pace."

The ongoing changes in policies in both China and the US may further impact the gold market, with potential interest rate cuts from China and a cautious approach by the Federal Reserve signaling varying influences on gold prices.
newTitle: Gold Price Gains Amid Geopolitical Tensions and Upcoming Economic Data

title: Low-tech end to white-collar crime—how SEBI caught Ketan Parekh’s latest stock market fraud - ThePrint
summary:
Low-tech end to white-collar crime—how SEBI caught Ketan Parekh’s latest stock market fraud

Publication Date: New Delhi, Date Not Specified, Source: Not Specified

India’s stock market regulator has again found Ketan Parekh, the infamous stock broker previously imprisoned and banned from the markets for one of the country’s biggest stock market scams during the turn of the century, to be the lynchpin of yet another case of stock market illegality.

  • SEBI passed an interim order against Parekh, stating he transferred non-public information (NPI) to partners for illegal profits.
  • Through investigation, SEBI froze assets worth Rs 65.77 crore from 22 entities, including Parekh.
  • SEBI discovered front-running activities involving a US-based foreign portfolio investor referred to as ‘Big Client’.
  • Parekh and others used pseudonyms to communicate, leading to the illicit execution of trades.
“It was noted that the birth date of Ketan Parekh as mentioned on his PAN Card is also February 15, 1962.”

SEBI utilized call detail records, travel data, and other evidence to confirm Parekh's involvement and solidify their findings.
newTitle: SEBI Uncovers Ketan Parekh's Stock Market Fraud Using Low-Tech Methods

Suzlon Energy started the New Year on a high note but faced a setback shortly after. Following a significant upgrade from CRISIL Ratings, clarifications were made regarding recent price movements.

  • Suzlon shares rose significantly on January 1, 2025, before experiencing a downward trend in subsequent trading sessions.
  • The stock slipped by 1.50 percent as of January 3, trading at Rs 61.96.
  • CRISIL Ratings upgraded Suzlon's credit rating to 'CRISIL A' with a positive outlook.

Suzlon Energy has shown remarkable performance in the renewable energy sector, delivering returns of 63% in the past year alone.

title: India's IPO boom created seven billionaires in 2024; Find out who they are - CNBCTV18
summary:
India's IPO Boom Creates Seven New Billionaires in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: CNBCTV18.com

In a remarkable year for Initial Public Offerings (IPOs), India saw seven entrepreneurs gain billionaire status, largely from the renewable energy sector.

  • Record-breaking IPO year in 2024 raised ₹1.66 lakh crore, nearly three times the previous year.
  • The new billionaires include founders from various sectors: renewable energy, healthcare, automation, and liquor.
  • Waaree Energies valued at $10.6 billion made Hitesh C Doshi and family the wealthiest among the group with a net worth of $7.1 billion.
  • Premier Energies' Chiranjiv Singh Saluja saw his net worth rise to $4.7 billion from a market value of $7.3 billion.
  • Billionaires from Ola Electric, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, Acme Solar Holdings, Jyoti CNC Automation, and Allied Blenders & Distillers also joined the ranks.
  • Approximately 85 companies are expected to list in 2025, targeting ₹1.53 lakh crore.
"A strong potential for India’s IPO market is expected to continue with the anticipated influx of listings in various sectors."

In conclusion, the Indian IPO landscape has significantly propelled local entrepreneurs into billionaire status, showcasing the robust growth potential of various industries, especially renewable energy.
newTitle: India's IPO Boom Creates Seven New Billionaires in 2024
